info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 28 at 6:30PM EDT by NWS State College
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTHWESTERN ADAMS AND SOUTHEASTERN FRANKLIN COUNTIES THROUGH 715 PM EDT... At 630 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Waynesboro, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation possible. Locations impacted include... Waynesboro, Gettysburg, Carroll Valley, Wayne Heights, Bonneauville, Mont Alto, Lake Heritage, Rouzerville, Cashtown, Orrtanna, Hunterstown, Fairfield, McKnightstown, Quincy, Two Taverns, Gettysburg National Military Park, Liberty Mountain Resort, Penn State Mont Alto and Gettysburg College. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
